result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Leslie Hoskins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Leslie Hoskins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl appeared by video for James Leslie Hoskins.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Review hearing. Court reviewed Competency Report dated October 4, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Deborah Collins. Discussion placed on the record. Statements by Defense regarding option for Defendant to receive IN-PATIENT Competency Restoration. Defense will consult with the Forensic Unit and notify the Court if an Order is necessary. Court addressed Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial. Court advised Defendant that case was suspended; therefore, time limits are tolled. Case adjourned for Review hearing, Branch 46. Review hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return. Court reviewed Competency Report dated July 6, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Thomas DeBoer. Discussion placed on the record. Parties reviewed and did not contest the report. Defendant confirmed. Court found the Defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense. Court ordered proceedings suspended. Court ordered the Defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Court further authorized DHS to administer medication and/or treatment to the Defendant. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. Court ordered Defendant TRANSPORTED FORTHWITH. Case adjourned for Review hearing, Branch 46. Review hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am. Hearing will be held and Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
- received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
-received and filed.
Letter from defendant re:  release.  (James L. Hoskins, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan on behalf of Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Court reviewed Competency Report dated June 3, 2022 and submitted by Dr. Deborah Collins. Discussion placed on the record. Parties did not contest the report. For reasons provided in the report, Dr. Collins recommended an IN-PATIENT EVALUATION. Court ordered Defendant remanded for an IN-PATIENT EVALUATION at a DHS Mental Health Institute. 

Additionally, Defendant requested new counsel. Statements by Defense and Defendant. Court took Defense Motion to Withdraw under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:20 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Competency Report dated June 3, 2022 from Dr. Deborah Collins; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Affidavit.  (James L. Hoskins, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Defendant's request for new counsel.
Court will address at the next hearing (June 9, 2022)
Defendant's Motion for Recognizance Bond per Speedy Trial Rules.  (James L. Hoskins, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Letter from defendant re:  request for new counsel due to ineffectiveness of current counsel.  (James L. Hoskins, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
-signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk provided copy to WFU and the parties.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Parties are ready to proceed; however, Defense advised the Court that there is reason to believe the Defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered Defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Court TOLLED DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL. Court ordered case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:20 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. DEFENDANT WILL BE PRODUCED.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. Parties provided an update to the Court regarding discovery issue. Defense requested an adjournment within the Defendant's Speedy Trial deadline. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense request for an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:25 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.

Case re-called. Same appearances. Case remains in trial posture. Statements by the parties. Case passed to this afternoon.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Jury Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. No issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Parties advised the Court of discovery material issues. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Jury Status hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in Court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant previously filed a DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested time to review case with Defendant. Court granted request. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $50,000.00.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLR, dob 9/30/1990 and COL, dob 3/23/1972

Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant James Leslie Hoskins in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Leslie Hoskins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 5 and 6.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
